title: Soba noodle  and tofu salad

ingredients.content: 6 sprigs fresh coriander, roots and stalks (leaves reserved for garnishing)
200 g extra firm tofu, cut into pieces (1 cm thick x 2-3 cm length)
1 fresh Lebanese cucumber (approx. 100 g), cut into halves lengthways, deseeded and thinly sliced
2 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into thin slices
80 g snow peas, cut into thin slices
1 fresh chilli, cut into thin slices

preparations.content: Place all ingredients, except tofu, into mixing bowl and mix <b>5 sec/speed 9<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.
Transfer dressing into a large bowl, add sliced tofu and stir to combine. Set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position and weigh edamame beans into it. Secure Varoma lid and cook  <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma and stir edamame.

Add soba noodles into mixing bowl, place Varoma back into position and cook <b>3 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Transfer edamame into a bowl and set aside to cool. Once cooled, remove beans from pods and discard pods. Set beans aside.
Transfer noodles into Varoma dish and rinse under cold water to cease cooking. Set aside to drain.
Transfer drained noodles into large bowl with dressing and tofu and stir to combine.
Transfer noodles onto a serving platter, top with remaining ingredients and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own tahini, refer to the Tahini recipe on this recipe chip.
This salad is best eaten on the day it is made.
You can find edamame beans in the frozen food section of most supermarkets.
